intro: Ligusticum lucidum subsp. huteri, commonly known as the Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hollow stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive pungent odor. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and arranged in compound umbels. It is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
